Description: Green basanite bust of Germanicus Caesar in military dress. The nose has been mutilated, probably in late antiquity by Christians who cut a cross in the forehead. There are further areas of damage on the chest and around the nose.
Bibliographic references: Sculpture / Catalogue of Greek Sculpture in the British Museum (1883)
Fluck et al. 2015 / Egypt: Faith after the Pharaohs (96)
Elsner et al 2017 / Imagining the Divine: Art and the Rise of World Religions (108)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2015, Apr-Sep, Berlin, Bode Museum, One God 2015, Oct 29 – 2016, Feb 7. British Museum, Room 35. Egypt: Faith after the Pharaohs. 2016-2017, Oct-May, Defacing the Past exhibition at BM
Acquisition name: Donated by: Rev Greville John Chester
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Rev Greville John Chester
